metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29424 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Net::Netmask module before 2.0000 for Perl does not properly consider extraneous zero characters at the beginning of an IP address string, which (in some situations) allows attackers to bypass access control that is based on IP addresses.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-29424` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnet-netmask-perl - 1.9104-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> blog.urth.org reports many perl modules affected; I don't know if this CVE number applies to something else entirely, all of them, or just one of these packages.

criterions.comment: libnet-netmask-perl package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9104-2').
libnetwork-ipv4addr-perl package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
